DataElement.preferredName: Neurologic Evaluation Muscle Strength Finding Response Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric code to represent the result of  muscle strength testing during a neurologic evaluation. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or used in or practicing neurology.._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria._force exerted by a muscle, as a response parameter (e.g. bioassay) or as an indicator of health, endurance, fitness, etc._Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Property.preferredDefinition: force exerted by a muscle, as a response parameter (e.g. bioassay) or as an indicator of health, endurance, fitness, etc.:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: force exerted by a muscle, as a response parameter (e.g. bioassay) or as an indicator of health, endurance, fitness, etc.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Tissue responsible for the body movements and the shape and size changes of interna organs. Muscle tissue is composed of specialized contractile cells. There are two types of muscle tissue recognized: striated and smooth muscle. The striated muscle tissue is further subdivided into skeletal, visceral striated, and cardiac muscle. (NCI)_Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria._Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: The patient may move the muscle against gravity but not against resistance from the examiner.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: The patient may move the muscle against gravity but not against resistance from the examiner.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The patient may move the muscle against gravity but not against resistance from the examiner.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: The patient is able to actively move the muscle when gravity is eliminated.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: The patient is able to actively move the muscle when gravity is eliminated.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The patient is able to actively move the muscle when gravity is eliminated.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A trace contraction is noted by palpating the muscle while the patient attempts to contract it.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A trace contraction is noted by palpating the muscle while the patient attempts to contract it.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A trace contraction is noted by palpating the muscle while the patient attempts to contract it.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: The patient moves the muscle group and overcomes the resistance from the examiner; this is normal muscle strength.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: The patient moves the muscle group and overcomes the resistance from the examiner; this is normal muscle strength.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The patient moves the muscle group and overcomes the resistance from the examiner; this is normal muscle strength.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: The patient may move the muscle group against some resistance from the examiner.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: The patient may move the muscle group against some resistance from the examiner.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The patient may move the muscle group against some resistance from the examiner.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Muscle Tissue; an animal tissue consisting predominantly of contractile cells.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.:Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Tissue responsible for the body movements and the shape and size changes of internal organs.  Muscle tissue is composed of specialized contractile cells.  There are two types of muscle tissue recognized: striated and smooth muscle.  The striated muscle tissue is further subdivided into skeletal, visceral striated, and cardiac muscle.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D
